name: Confederation of European Computer User Associations
goal:
The objective of CECUA is the development of the use of Information Technoogy in Europe. It represents groups of users of Information technologies. Its principal objectives are:

- To act as a users voice, in particular covering general matters of concern with respect to the use and the provision of information technology in private sector, society, profession and economy.
- To enable users to express their opinions and consequently to clarify any decisions and actions to be taken by European Institutions, in particular the European Economic Community, in connection with the use of information technology.
- To facilitate exchanges between users of different countries and also the development of concerted action.
- To disseminate information on matters of general interest to and about users.
- To prepare materials in the form of advisory documents, studies, precedents, and other tools to be of assistance to users.
interests: Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Transport, Youth
